image.altText: A woman holding the outstretched arm of a skeleton.

props.synopsis: Multiple female physiotherapists say they've experienced gender-based harassment while working for male sporting teams, often being the only woman in the change rooms.

title.children: Female physiotherapists experiencing gender-based harassment in male-dominated industry

image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: The first jury to deliver a majority verdict in the ACT convicts a 30-year-old Canberra public servant of sexually assaulting a colleague after a Christmas party.

title.children: Canberra public servant found guilty of sexually assaulting colleague after Christmas party

image.altText: An ice climber carefully strikes the wall of ice with his ice axe.

props.synopsis: Ice climbing, introduced to Australia by migrants in the 1960s, is booming as extreme sport lovers seek higher thrills — but with such a short season, you have to book early.

title.children: 'You wouldn't believe it's Australia': Climbing walls of ice in our own backyard

image.altText: buses in a depot

props.synopsis: The drivers' union and public transport association say they warned Transport Canberra about problems with the MyWay+ ticketing system before it was launched this week. The ACT government says those "teething problems'' are being fixed.

title.children: Transport Canberra was warned repeatedly about new ticketing system issues ahead of launch

image.altText: A politician cartoon showing dinosaurs arguing about nuclear and gas power.

props.synopsis: Upon being named the 2024 Political Cartoonist of the Year, Megan Herbert demanded a recount.

title.children: 'You have to be brave to do it': The best political cartoons of 2024

image.altText: A bucket is full to the brim with many dead beetles bodies.

props.synopsis: A run of hot weather is likely responsible for scarab beetles swarming some homes and business in the ACT region.

title.children: 'I thought it was raining': Swarms of beetles descend on Canberra homes

image.altText: An image of a middle-aged woman wearing a bright blue dress with blonde hair, standing outside near trees.

props.synopsis: Melissa Yarnold, a transgender woman, says nobody should have to go through what she experienced while in custody.

title.children: 'I was so scared': Trans woman speaks out over treatment in NSW men's prison

image.altText: A screenshot of a man walking in between two police officers towards a car, shot from behind.

props.synopsis: A Canberra ice-skating coach is freed on bail after police charged him with 10 sexual offences against a former student.

title.children: Canberra ice-skating coach charged with sexual offences against former student is granted bail

image.altText: 19-year-old girl witih hair in braids and white top looks out to distance

props.synopsis: The major parties are united on the need to protect young people by banning them from social media. But experts say dialling back something that has become so pervasive in the lives of children and teenagers requires nuance — and more time — to get right.

title.children: Five years ago, teenagers got 300,000 people to a climate protest. Anjali says it couldn't happen without social media

image.altText: Blue tarp can be seen at the side of the factory outside Vientiane, Laos

props.synopsis: A Laos government document obtained by the ABC suggests the source of a methanol poisoning outbreak that killed six tourists is a rundown factory outside of Vientiane that was making vodka and whisky.

title.children: Laos government document points to rundown factory as source of methanol poisoning

image.altText: A photo of a white car with blasted windows and doors.

props.synopsis: The food charity says it is pausing its operations in Gaza after a vehicle carrying its staff members was hit by an Israeli air strike.

title.children: Israeli military says it was targeting Hamas 'terrorist' in strike that reportedly killed three World Central Kitchen aid workers

image.altText: A couple smiles.

props.synopsis: A couple found dead at their takeaway shop in Sydney's west have been identified as Hoa Tek Chiem and Kim Heang Gau.

title.children: Son faces court charged with murdering parents in Buzzy Bee's Burger House takeaway shop in Sydney's west

image.altText: Snake catcher Tim Nanninga captures a tiger snake on the Monash Freeway.

props.synopsis: You might have heard of the movie Snakes on a Plane. But what happens if you're driving down a busy city freeway, and you suddenly, terrifyingly, feel a tiger snake slithering up your leg?

title.children: Rattled driver forced to pull over on busy Melbourne freeway after tiger snake slithers up leg

image.altText: Rows of houses and streets line a village with mountains in the background.

props.synopsis: Americans unhappy with the US election result are being encouraged to move to Italy. But will anyone take up the offer?

title.children: A home on an Italian island can be bought for only 1 euro — but there are some catches

image.altText: A woman in a yellow top and teens clutches her stomach on a couch

props.synopsis: Visanne, also known by the generic name dienogest, will have its cost reduced from more than $800 per year for a course of daily tablets to $380 per year, or around $90 per year for pension and concession card holders.

title.children: Endometriosis treatment to be listed on PBS for the first time in 30 years

image.altText: A blonde woman standing facing away with a Ukraine flag covering her back in front of the Sydney Harbour Bridge

props.synopsis: Since February 24, 2022 the Australian government has granted more than 11,500 visas to Ukrainian refugees who were desperate to flee conflict and find a place of safety. Here are some of their stories.

title.children: These refugees' lives in Ukraine were torn away by war. Now they call Australia home

image.altText: A group of young men and women in island shirts and island dresses.

props.synopsis: A landmark case that began in a Pacific classroom and could change the course of future climate talks is about to be heard in the International Court of Justice.

title.children: The 'David and Goliath moment' at The Hague that could change future climate talks

image.altText: A woman sitting against a kitchen counter at home.

props.synopsis: Mum of two Jane Dutton has made the call to shut down her kids' social media before the ban comes into effect from the end of next year. Like many parents, she felt pressure to allow her children onto the platforms in the first place.

title.children: Mum who let kids onto social media so they would 'fit in' starts under-16s ban straight away

image.altText: A graphic artwork of a man in a suit with his eyes obscured, with cameras and a large building also visible in the background

props.synopsis: Being a secret agent might seem like a glamorous job, but agencies in the West are struggling to attract the next generation of spies due to many young people prioritising issues such as climate change and COVID-19 over national security.

title.children: Britain and Australia have a spy shortage and recruiting the next generation is proving difficult

image.altText: Australia' Jakara Anthony skies down a moguls course in a World Cup event, flexing as she navigates through the bumps.

props.synopsis: Moguls skier Jakara Anthony makes history in Finland, with her 42nd World Cup podium finish, making her the most successful Australian winter sport athlete ever.

title.children: Jakara Anthony becomes Australia's most successful winter sport athlete with podium in Finland

image.altText: Noah Lolesio runs the ball for the Wallabies against Ireland.

props.synopsis: Fears the British and Irish Lions will complete a series whitewash next year should be put to bed, as the Wallabies showed enough on their Northern Hemisphere tour to suggest they will be more than competitive, writes Luke Pentony.

title.children: Wallabies' spring tour shows next year's British and Irish Lions series will be no walkover

image.altText: Mawuyal Yanthalawuy Manganinnie publicity still

props.synopsis: Award-winning actor, educator and community leader Mawuyul Yanthalawuy, who starred in the film Manganinnie, is being remembered as a "national treasure" after her death at the age of 85.

title.children: Born in the bush, Mawuyul Yanthalawuy survived Japanese bombs before becoming a teacher and a movie star

image.altText: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu speaks on stahe behind a lectern.

props.synopsis: A controversy is unfolding in Israel over classified military documents, allegedly leaked by an aide to Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, that may have harmed efforts to free hostages held by Hamas.

title.children: An aide to Netanyahu is accused of leaking secret documents to derail hostage talks

image.altText: A young white boy with red hair sitting in a wheelchair smiling at an adult. They're in a school classroom

props.synopsis: Starting school can be challenging for any child, but there can be extra difficulties for those with disability. ABC NEWS looks at two examples of public schools and families working together to set students with disability up for success.

title.children: When looking at schools for her son, Fiona interviewed the staff – not the other way around

image.altText: An older man wearing a hat and blue shirt holding a white dog standing next to two Australian kelpies

props.synopsis: From babies and puppies, to charity work and training, this is what the participants of ABC iview's Muster Dogs series are up to now.

title.children: Frank Finger, Zoe Miller and other Muster Dogs stars on life after the series

image.altText: A satellite image of lava snaking through mountainous terrain

props.synopsis: Iceland's famous Blue Lagoon has been temporarily closed as lava continues to spill from a volcanic fissure on the Reykjanes Peninsula.

title.children: Icelandic volcano eruption forces closure of tourist destination as wall of lava cuts off roads

image.altText: Michael Callaghan and Gregor Cullen at Redback studios in black and white.

props.synopsis: In the 80s, hipster youths Michael Callaghan and Gregor Cullen screen-printed street posters in a park in Wollongong. Their posters are now sitting in collections in major art institutions.

title.children: How screen-printed 1980s posters from Wollongong came to sit in major art collections

image.altText: Australian actor Hugo Weaving with a white beard smiling with a santa het.

props.synopsis: How do you turn an iconic Aussie song into a movie? In the case of How To Make Gravy, the secret is in the source... material.

title.children: A Christmas movie musical set in prison? Paul Kelly's How To Make Gravy gets the film treatment

image.altText: crowds with hands in the air in front of the stage at Meredith

props.synopsis: In a year when many Australian music festivals have announced they're folding or postponed, Meredith Music Festival will nurture its familiar rituals like the brass band once again.

title.children: Regulars at music festival that's been running for 32 years think they know the secret to its success

image.altText: North Melbourne win the 2024 AFLW premiership cup.

props.synopsis: North Melbourne dominate Brisbane in the AFLW grand final to win first flag by an expansion club.

title.children: 'Our first silverware in 25 years': North Melbourne women's team break club drought

image.altText: Gavin Smith stands at the office in the caravan park wearing a green shirt and hat smiling.

props.synopsis: It's not your typical retirement plan but Gavin Smith is in it "boots and all" giving new life to a caravan park in a town he first fell in love with 50 years ago.

title.children: For Gavin's 70th birthday, he bought himself a caravan park in the outback

image.altText: A man wearing a beanie and wet-weather gear, seen from above, holds onto a rope while partially submerged in water.

props.synopsis: Authorities say a 65-year-old Lithuanian man who had his left leg amputated at the knee during a complex rescue operation in Tasmania's remote south-west is now in a stable condition in hospital.

title.children: Man who had leg amputated in Franklin River rescue now in a stable condition

image.altText: The side of a police car with the logo and word Police.

props.synopsis: Police said the boy, who was a passenger in the vehicle, was trapped in the car after the crash. Three other boys have been arrested.

title.children: Teenage boy fighting for life after stolen car crashes into tree

image.altText: A man in a yellow and blue shirt sits in a dialysis chair receiving treatment

props.synopsis: Edwin Foster drives a round-trip of 250 kilometres three times a week for kidney dialysis treatment. He's one of thousands rural Australians travelling long distances for the life-saving treatment.

title.children: Rural dialysis patients travelling thousands of kilometres a year to reach treatment

image.altText: Hard Quiz host Tom Gleeson with his eyebrows raised and mouth open. The Hard Quiz logo is in the top right corner

props.synopsis: I bet you won't even get half of these curly questions right.

title.children: C'mon, put your trivia know-how to the test — I dare you
